com.github.triceo.splitlog

Class LogWatchBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.triceo.splitlog.LogWatchBuilder

  • public final class LogWatchBuilder
extends Object
    Prepares an instance of LogWatch. Unless overriden by the user, the instance will have the following properties:
    Reads file from beginning?
    Yes.
    Closes file when the reading is finished?
    No.
    The default interval between each read
    See DEFAULT_DELAY_BETWEEN_READS_IN_MILLISECONDS.
    The buffer size for reading
    See DEFAULT_READ_BUFFER_SIZE_IN_BYTES.
    Default tail splitter
    See SimpleTailSplitter
    Default message capacity
    Integer.MAX_VALUE, the maximum possible. See MessageStore
    Interval between two sweeps for unreachable messages.
    See DEFAULT_DELAY_BETWEEN_SWEEPS_IN_MILLISECONDS.
    Interval between requesting tailing and the actual start of tailing.
    See DEFAULT_DELAY_BEFORE_TAILING_IN_MILLISECONDS. Please see withDelayBeforeTailingStarts(int, TimeUnit) for an explanation of why this is necessary.
    By default, the instance will allow every message through.

      • build

        public LogWatch build()
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden. Such log watch will not start actually reading getFileToWatch() until after LogWatch.startFollowing() or MessageProducer.startConsuming(com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.MessageListener) .
        Returns:
        The newly built log watch.

      • buildFollowing

        public Follower buildFollowing()
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden, and immediately start listening for Messages.
        Returns:
        The follower that will receive the initial messages. The actual LogWatch can be retrieved by Follower.getFollowed().

      • buildFollowingWith

        public Follower buildFollowingWith(TailSplitter splitter)
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden, and immediately start listening for Messages
        Parameters:
        splitter - The splitter instance to use for the log watch instead of the default.
        Returns:
        The follower that will receive the initial messages. The actual LogWatch can be retrieved by Follower.getFollowed().

      • buildWith

        public LogWatch buildWith(TailSplitter splitter)
        Build the log watch with previously defined properties, or defaults where not overriden. Such log watch will not start actually reading getFileToWatch() until after LogWatch.startFollowing() or MessageProducer.startConsuming(com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.MessageListener) .
        Parameters:
        splitter - The splitter instance to use for the log watch instead of the default.
        Returns:
        The newly built log watch. This log watch will not start tailing until after LogWatch.startFollowing() or MessageProducer.startConsuming(com.github.triceo.splitlog.api.MessageListener) .

      • withDelayBeforeTailingStarts

        public LogWatchBuilder withDelayBeforeTailingStarts(int length,
                                           TimeUnit unit)
        Specify the delay between when the log tailing is requested and when it is actually started. In order for LogWatch.startFollowing(MidDeliveryMessageCondition) to actually work, we need the tailer to start after we are already waiting. But the waiting will block the thread, making it impossible to start the tailer. Therefore, we schedule the tailer on a different thread before we start waiting and we delay the actual execution by this amount, so that the waiting has time to start.
        Parameters:
        length - Length of time.
        unit - Unit of that length.
        Returns:
        This.

      • withDelayBetweenReads
